edu.mhs.compsys.processing

Class BinaryImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mhs.compsys.processing.BinaryImage

  • public class BinaryImage
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for easy operations on binary images. This class is simply a datastore and is not an actual image. It can however be converted to BufferedImage via toBufferedImage;

    The representation is simply a 2d array of booleans.

    X,Y is 0,0 at the Top Left corner and increases as you go down and to the left

      • BinaryImage

        public BinaryImage(java.lang.String str,
           java.lang.String sep)
        Initializes a new BinaryImage from the given string. '1's are true and '0's are false. sep determines a new pixel row.
        Parameters:
        str -
        sep -

      • inverse

        public BinaryImage inverse()
        Inverts the image, setting each true pixel to false and each false pixel to true .
        Returns:
        A new BinaryImage that is the Inverse of this one.

      • or

        public BinaryImage or(BinaryImage other)
        Returns the logical and of the two BinaryImages. Each pixel in the second image are only true if they are true in this or the 'other' images.
        Parameters:
        other - BinaryImage to OR
        Returns:
        A new BinaryImage that is equivalent to each pixel || with its counterpart.

      • and

        public BinaryImage and(BinaryImage other)
        Returns the logical and of the two BinaryImages. Each pixel in the second image are only true if they are true in both this and 'other' images.
        Parameters:
        other - BinaryImage to AND
        Returns:
        A new BinaryImage that is equivalent to each pixel && with its counterpart.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(BinaryImage other)
        Checks whether the two BinaryImages show the same data.
        Parameters:
        other -
        Returns:
        True if the images are the same, false otherwise.
